data.Summary: Fifteen years of Governance, Risk, and Compliance (GRC) experience, including third-party vendor risk management (TPRM), Payment Card Industry (PCI), Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX), SOC2, NIST, ISO27001, policies and procedures, and cloud security auditing. Five years of information security experience, including security operations management, cybersecurity tools implementation and management (vulnerability scanning, endpoint security, logging, IPS), and incident response.
data.Title: Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Consultant

positions.Title: Governance Risk and Compliance (GRC) Consultant
positions.Description:
•	Performed a security and compliance assessment of a client's AWS cloud environment using NIST CSF and 800-53.
•	Created two third-party risk management (TPRM) programs. Created policies and provided training.
•	Revised IT-SOX controls to address audit deficiencies. Created a dashboard to provide status to senior management.

positions.Title: Technical Program Manager, Third-Party Risk Management
positions.Description:
•	Obtained approval and transitioned the TPRM program from Google meeting Google’s Consent Decree requirements, creating policies and procedures, designing an efficient program to streamline assessments, and managing risk.
•	Implemented and automated the program using Prevalent’s GRC TPRM tool, resulting in a 50% reduction in assessment time.
•	Completed 70 third-party assessments, including meeting with stakeholders and vendors, reviewing due diligence questionnaires and documentation (penetration tests, SOC 2, ISO 27001, network diagrams), determining risks, revising contracts, and creating escalations and risk acceptances.
•	Created a status dashboard resulting in 50% fewer status inquiries.
•	Received five awards from stakeholders (business, legal, contracts, security, and senior management) for providing clear guidance, resolving issues, and removing friction. 
•	Trained and mentored one employee with no TPRM experience to complete assessments without assistance in two months.

positions.Title: Enterprise Security Compliance Manager, Third-Party Risk
positions.Description:
•	Performed 40 assessments, including gathering and reviewing evidence, evaluating risk, recommending risk mitigations, reviewing contracts, and presenting reports to the Cloud Security Steering Committee.
•	Streamlined processes and reports, resulting in a 25% reduction in time to complete assessments.
•	Reduced friction with vendor stakeholders by providing training and weekly status reports.

positions.Title: Cloud Security and Compliance Engineer
positions.Description:
Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX):
•	Designed controls and reviews. Reduced access review time by 75% and removed stakeholder involvement using Excel and Python. Performed five monthly and ten quarterly reviews. Led and passed three audits.
Payment Card Industry (PCI):
•	Designed and executed controls. Implemented and performed AWS vulnerability scanning. Managed a Level ROC audit with no findings, resulting in Level 1 compliance. 
Third-Party Risk Management
•	Designed and implemented the program, including creating policies, procedures, and questionnaires.
•	Performed 30 assessments, including evaluating vendors’ questionnaire responses and evidence and recommending whether to approve vendors.
•	Optimized vendor assessment workflows by integrating the OneTrust GRC tool, which reduced assessment times by a quarter.
Cybersecurity Engineering (AWS, LAN, and Mac)
•	Championed deploying and managing cutting-edge security tools, resulting in robust monitoring and rapid incident resolution. Tools included Qualys VMDR (vulnerability scanning), Crowdstrike Falcon (endpoint detection and response), Obsidian (SaaS security monitoring), and Axonius (asset management).
•	Solved two security incidents and provided evidence for lawsuits.

positions.Title: IT Security and Compliance Analyst
positions.Description:
Brought on as the first dedicated resource to enhance and mature the information security and compliance program.  The environment included over three thousand servers and six petabytes of data

•	Developed information security policies and procedures to comply with ISO27001.
•	Developed and implemented a vulnerability scanning and remediation program, selecting, evaluating, implementing and tools, and performing scans and performing and remediation.  Eliminated 15% of the environment’s vulnerabilities per month.
•	Incident response lead.  Investigated and resolved of two security incidents, including developing processes to prevent similar incidents.
•	Managed two comprehensive external audits for Prosearch’s largest financial customer.
•	Upgraded the URL filtering system and added high availability.
•	Developed a risk matrix and review it quarterly with senior management.
•	Developed a security awareness program.  Performed multiple training sessions for all company staff.
•	Perform daily monitoring of antimalware solution, IPS and application vulnerability scanning.

positions.Title: Sr. Analyst, IT Compliance
positions.Description:
Hired to enhance and expand the third-party vendor assessment program.

•	Reviewed and streamlined existing processes to allow greater volume while maintaining the same level of thoroughness. Revised the vendor questionnaire.
•	Performed three third-party assessments per week. Wrote detailed reports for each assessment, including risks and recommendations.
•	Reviewed vendor SOC2’s.
•	Assisted EMC/RSA Archer administration.

positions.Title: Manager IT Security
positions.Description:
Tower lead for operational Information Security (IS), User Access Management (UAM) and UAM related IT-SOX.  Responsibilities included:
•	Daily management of 3 onshore and 17 offshore resources, including task assignments, prioritization, scheduling and follow-up.
•	IS and UAM issue resolution.
•	Security incident response.
•	Vulnerability scanning (Qualys and nMap).
•	Support of security hardware and software, including firewalls and NIDS (Cisco PIX and ASA), proxy servers (Microsoft ISA and Websense), antivirus (Trend Micro), security event analysis (NetIQ Security Manager), HIDS (Trend Micro Deep Security) and encryption (Vormetric).
•	Monthly and quarterly review of IT-SOX UAM controls, including control design changes.
•	New IS technology implementation, including Varonis, Websense Triton, Fireeye and Splunk.
Security project management, including requirements gathering, interfacing with business users, determining scope, determining costs, team management and quality control.  Projects include:
•	Upgrade of vulnerability scanning infrastructure.
•	Security event logging.
•	User account permissions verification.
•	Advanced Persistent Threat tools.
•	PCI compliance.
•	Firewall upgrades.
•	Flat file encryption tools upgrade.

positions.Title: IT Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) Compliance Manager
positions.Description:
Responsible for all day-to-day tactical aspects of Lionsgate’s IT risk management.  This included managing the company’s change control process (including TV Guide) and performing a key control review of all completed change requests.  Duties included performing and resolving issues with daily, monthly, and quarterly monitoring and reporting on over half of the IT department key controls.  Oversaw the risk management of logical security access to the SAP environments (SAP, BW, and CRM) as well as executing detailed analysis of user security for overall network access.  These tasks included dozens of processes to ensure that the two highest risk areas within IT (change control and logical access) never had an audit failure or any fraudulent activity.

Acted as a strong and independent advocate for all areas of infrastructure, compliance and security. Upon arrival at Lionsgate, their Year One Sarbanes-Oxley audit had failed.  After joining the IT SOX group, Lionsgate passed six consecutive audits and were highly regarded by Ernst & Young as one of the most effective compliance operations in the Entertainment industry.
•	Generated, reviewed and resolved issues with monthly and quarterly SOX IT compliance reports.
•	Worked with groups within and outside of IT to insure SOX compliance.
•	For the TV Guide acquisition, assessed network, application and control environment. Created SOX and compliance procedures for change control, user and data center access.  Acted as on-going compliance liaison for issue resolution and process improvement.  Interfaced with all levels of IT management and staff.
•	Designed security controls for email disaster recovery.
•	Documented, tested and remediated general computer controls.
•	Responsible for management of IT change control, including writing policies and procedures, initial and final review of documentation and reviewing testing.
